intro: Tagetes gracilis, commonly known as slender marigold, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves and bright yellow or orange flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardeners seeking vibrant, low-maintenance ornamental plants. Its essential oils contain compounds with potential insect-repelling properties, adding to its horticultural value.
